  "description": "AllFlavors Supreme Foods manufactures premium snacks with high quality ingredients, using top quality machines and advanced techniques to reach and maintain our products&#39; premium quality. We are ISO 9001 and 22000 certified.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Amuwo Odofin, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Quality Control (QC) Officer to ensure that all products meet approved quality, safety, and regulatory standards before, during, and after production.


Responsibilities


	Monitor and inspect raw materials, production processes, and finished products
	Ensure compliance with food safety, hygiene, and GMP standards
	Conduct routine quality checks on production and packaging processes
	Identify defects and recommend corrective actions
	Maintain accurate quality control records and reports
	Enforce adherence to NAFDAC, SON, and internal quality standards
	Collaborate with Production, Storage, and Management teams
	Support internal and external quality audits


Requirements


	HND/BSc in Food Science &amp; Technology, Microbiology, Biochemistry, or related field, 1&ndash;3 years of&nbsp;QC experience in an FMCG or food manufacturing environment
	Strong knowledge of food safety standards and quality control procedures
	Good observation, reporting, and documentation skills
	Ability to work with minimal supervision
	Familiarity with peanut processing is an added advantage


Skills:


	A strong communication skill.
	Ability to interpret data.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to maintain accurate records.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High level of integrity.


What We Offer


	Hands-on experience in a dynamic and supportive food manufacturing environment
	Exposure to real-world quality assurance systems and audits
	Opportunity to work alongside experienced professionals and gain industry insight.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;qc@allflavors.odoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

	Monitor and inspect raw materials, production processes, and finished products

	Conduct routine quality checks on production and packaging processes
	Identify defects and recommend corrective actions
	Maintain accurate quality control records and reports
	Enforce adherence to NAFDAC, SON, and internal quality standards
	Collaborate with Production, Storage, and Management teams
	Support internal and external quality audits


Requirements


	HND/BSc in Food Science & Technology, Microbiology, Biochemistry, or related field, 1–3 years of QC experience in an FMCG or food manufacturing environment
	Strong knowledge of food safety standards and quality control procedures
	Good observation, reporting, and documentation skills
	Ability to work with minimal supervision
	Familiarity with peanut processing is an added advantage


Skills:


	A strong communication skill.
	Ability to interpret data.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to maintain accurate records.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High level of integrity.


What We Offer


	Hands-on experience in a dynamic and supportive food manufacturing environment
	Exposure to real-world quality assurance systems and audits
	Opportunity to work alongside experienced professionals and gain industry insight.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: qc@allflavors.odoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Finance & Admin Assistant Job at SKOT Communications




        
    

        
        SKOT Communications is a global strategic communications consultancy with a strong Sub-Saharan Africa focus. At SKOT, we believe that every individual and corporate has a unique story to tell, it's finding your voice that makes all the difference.

Using our expertise, creativity, and innovative ideas, we not only define, redefine, or amplify your voice, but we use it to create connections; connections that grow relationships and loyalty and deliver results you can measure.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance & Admin Assistant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role

	The Finance and Admin Assistant provides comprehensive support across financial management, human resources, and administrative operations.
	This role ensures smooth day-to-day running of the office, accurate financial record-keeping, and efficient HR processes that support both employees and management.


Qualifications


	Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Human Resources, or a related field.
	1 - 3 years of experience in finance, HR, or administrative support roles.
	Basic understanding of accounting and HR processes.
	Experience working in a fast-paced office environment is an advantage.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) and basic finance/HR software.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.
	Proactive, flexible, and team-oriented attitude.
